snippet: Syria said it had released more than 500 prisoners, while a human rights group said it had gathered the names of at least 617 people who had died under government torture.
abstract: Syrian government says it has released more than 500 prisoners who were not involved in terrorist acts, while a human rights group says it has compiled evidence that thousands of detainees are still languishing in prisons and secret detention centers and that at least 617 people have died under government torture.
lead_paragraph: Syria said it had released more than 500 prisoners, while a human rights group said it had gathered the names of at least 617 people who had died under government torture.

headline.seo: Hundreds Tortured in Syria, Human Rights Group Says
headline.main: Hundreds Tortured in Syria, Human Rights Group Says
headline.print_headline: Hundreds Tortured in Syria, Human Rights Group Says
